provider.documentation: Name of the person who has filled this file

mapping_info.provider: R. Coelho, C. Fuchs, P. McCarthy, R. McDermott, L. Barrera, M. Reich, G. Tardini, O. Asunta, B. Kurzan

description.documentation: Detailed description of this mapping file

mapping_info.description: Mapping data for JET assembled from multiple CPOs snippets: shot series CXDIAG (26160); shot series ECEDIAG (30151); shot series EQUILIBRIUM_EQI (30716); shot series INTERFDIAG (8646); shot series MAGDIAG (25891); shot series MSEDIAG (8646); shot series NBI (8646); shot series PFSYSTEMS (26695); shot series TOROIDFIELD (30716); shot series TSDIAG (26000); shot series WALL (30136)

firstputdate.documentation: Date when this file was first submitted to the ITM

lastputdate.documentation: Date when this file was last updated

shot_min.documentation: Minimum shot number in the experiment database for which this mapping file is valid

shot_max.documentation: Maximum shot number in the experiment database for which this mapping file is valid

download_method.documentation: List of the possible download methods (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

name.documentation: Name of the download method (e.g. 'mds+', 'tslib')

download_method.name: mds+

server.documentation: IP address of the experimental data server

port.documentation: Port for communication with the experimental data server

ssh_server.documentation: IP address or name of a remote ssh server for secure access

datainfo.documentation: Generic information on a data item

dataprovider.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

putdate.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

source.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

datainfo.source: Exchange of info with Rachel McDermott; there is also a wiki at the AUG Intranet
datainfo.comment: The fundamentals for the different dataseries of CX are: Series 1 starts at 8646 since this is our lower limit. Ends at 21741 since the CMZ edge diagnostic became available at 21742. The Ti data is stored on Ti variables (no Zeeman correction);Series 2 : starts at 21742 since that is when CMZ became available. Ends at 24999 since after 25000 the Ti and error is stored at _c suffix since it contains the Zeeman correction. The Ti data is still stored on Ti variable (no Zeeman correction); Series 3 : starts at 25000 since Ti_c becomes available here. Ends at 26159 since roughly the CPZ (measures also poloidal rotation) becomes routinely available at this shot; Series 4 : starts at 26160 since the CPZ becomes available here. No shot end for the moment.....

cocos.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

position.documentation: Position of the measurement. Time-dependent. Vector (nchannels)

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: %TDI%_aux=augdiag(%SHOT%,"CEZ","R"); public _poscez=MINLOC(_aux); public _rgcez=BUILD_RANGE(0,_poscez -1,1); _sig=value_of(_aux)[_rgcez]

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector
abserror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

abserror.name: %TDI%_aux=augdiag(%SHOT%,"CMZ","err_vrot"); _nt= SIZE(_aux,0); _sig=make_signal(ZERO([_nt,SIZE(_rgcmz)]) -9d40,value_of(_aux)[*,_rgcmz],dim_of(_aux,0))

ecediag.documentation: Electron Cyclotron Emission Diagnostic; Time-dependent CPO

datainfo.documentation: Generic information on a data item

dataprovider.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

putdate.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

source.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

datainfo.source: Exchange of info with Laura Barrera and the file received ReadCEC_RMDshotfiles.odt
datainfo.comment: The fundamentals for the different dataseries of ECE are: #24203 marks a transition on how the los was calculated (unfortunately i cannot integrate it since there are no signals for the zwguide[1:3]; At #26000 a signal known before as .methods. becomes .METHODS. and the IFGROUP also appears (this enables the integration of the los); After 26920 the error in Te gain a dedicated abserror signal and the HARMONIC signal becomes a triplet (was a single parameter) so each IF group can actually target different harmonics; After 30151 the diagnostic name transits to RMD (but CEC still very much in use...)

cocos.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

frequency.documentation: Frequency of the ECE channels. Vector (nchannels)
frequency.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

frequency.name: %TDI%public _avail=augparam(%SHOT%,"CEC","parms-A","AVAILABL"); _nch=size(_avail); _sor=SORT(_avail); _min=MINLOC(ABS(MAP(_avail,_sor)-1)); _rg=build_range(_min,_nch -1,1); public _ngch=size(_rg); public _ord=_sor[_rg]; _tmp=augdiag(%SHOT%,"CEC","R-A"); public _nt=size(_tmp,0); public _time=dim_of(_tmp,0); _tmp=augparam(%SHOT%,"CEC","parms-A","IFGROUP"); public _ifindex=value_of(_tmp)[_ord]-1; public _zif=0.044d0*(dble(_ifindex)==0d0) + 0.075d0*(dble(_ifindex)==1d0) + 0.106d0*(dble(_ifindex)==2d0); _tmp=augparam(%SHOT%,"CEC","parms-A","f"); _sig=make_signal(SPREAD(value_of(_tmp)[_ord],0,_nt),SPREAD(value_of(_tmp)[_ord],0,_nt),_time)

r.name: %TDI%public _rmax=2.35d0; public _rmin=1.00d0; public _zlens=augparam(%SHOT%,"CEC","METHODS","ZLENS")*0.01d0; public _r1=_rmax -0.133d0; _r1arr=SPREAD(_r1,0,_ngch); _sig= _r1arr

value.name: %TDI%_tmp=augdiag(%SHOT%,"CEC","R-A"); _timeR=dim_of(_tmp,0); _sig=MAKE_SIGNAL(value_of(_tmp)[*,_ord],value_of(_tmp)[*,_ord],_timeR)

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

tria_lower.documentation: Lower triangularity of the plasma boundary; Time-dependent; Scalar
tria_lower.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

boundary.documentation: RZ description of the plasma boundary; This is formally declared as an array of structure to allow for time-dependent size of the R and Z vectors in the sub-structure below. However, boundary must be allocated to size 1. Time-dependent;

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

jphi.documentation: flux surface averaged toroidal current density = average(jphi/R) / average(1/R) [A/m^2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)
jphi.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

jphi.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

rho_tor.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate [m], to be used by the ETS and in many CPOs (coreprof, ...). Defined as sqrt(phi/pi/B0), where B0 = equilibrium/global_param/toroid_field/b0. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)
rho_tor.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

rho_tor.name: %TDI%_b0=MAKE_SIGNAL(_fdia[*,0]/_r0,_fdia[*,0]/_r0,dim_of(augdiag(%SHOT%,"EQI","PFL"),0)); _bubu=SPREAD(ABS(_b0),1,_xpos+1); _sig=SQRT( ABS(_phi)/($2PI/2) )/SQRT(_bubu)

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.name: %TDI%augdiag(%SHOT%,"EQI","PFL")

download.documentation: Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name

interfdiag.documentation: Interferometry; measures line-integrated electron density [m^-2]; Time-dependent CPO

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: DCK|H-1

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

relerror.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Scalar
relerror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

relerror.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

flux_loops.documentation: Poloidal flux loops RZ coordinates have 1 component for the full loop and two if there is a negative reference loop

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector
abserror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

abserror.name: abserror_from_oneandhalftesla_times_area

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time.

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: MAP|Bthe18

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time.

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: MAP|Bthe37

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time.

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

polarimetry.documentation: This structure accomodates the polarimetry setup and measurements of a mse diagnostic, as widely used in fusion devices. The final measurement is the tan(gamma) where gamma is the polarization angle of a particular spectral mse component.

measure.documentation: Measured value (MSE angle gamma [rad]). Time-dependent; Vector (nchords)

spectral.documentation: This structure accommodates the types needed on a spectral MSE diagnostic namely the emmissivity and the radiance spectra. It will be subsequenty upgraded with optical + photon detection elements since the structure will also be used for a synthetic spectral mse code.

radia_chord.documentation: MSE radiance characterization. This structure is used for each line of sight of the MSE setup and contains the geometry of the line of sight, the radiance(wavelength) for each polarization state, the quantization axis. Replicate the structure for each line of sight. Time-dependent

totradiance.documentation: Total Radiance integrated along the lines of sight (Wm^-2sr-^1). Vector (nwavelength)

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.documentation: List of the experimental time bases used for this CPO (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

name.documentation: Name of the time base in the experimental database

time.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name

nbi.documentation: Neutral Beam Injection. Input to NBI source codes; describes the neutrals that are about to be launched into the torus; Time-dependent CPO

nbi_unit.documentation: Vector of Neutral Beam Injector units. The NBI system should be separated in to the individually power strucutres. Structure array(nunits). Time-dependent

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

pow_unit.documentation: Power delivered by an NBI unit [W]; Time-dependent

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

value.name: %TDI%public _pow12=augsignal(%SHOT%,"NIS","PNIQ")[*,1,0]; _sig= _pow12

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

inj_eng_unit.documentation: Full injection energy of a unit [ev]; Time-dependent

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time.

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector
abserror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

abserror.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

datainfo.source: Exchange of info with Bern Kurzan and file xmldoc.txt received; there is also a wiki at the AUG Intranet
datainfo.comment: The fundamentals for the different dataseries of TS are: Series 1 #8646 - #18273 since the diagnostic name is VTN, different ports have different name (E, D, F) so one has to try to read them all; Series 2 is #18277 - #25890 and the diagnostic changes to VTA. The ports naming disappears but one is measuring either core or edge without much of a notice except when looking at the positions; Series 3 is #26005 to present and the diagnostic is again VTA. Both core and edge receive dedicated shotfile signal entries

cocos.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

position.documentation: Position of intersection between laser and line of sight; Vector (nchords)

r.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

r.name: %TDI%_aux=augdiag(%SHOT%,"VTA","Z_core"); public _nch= SIZE(_aux,0); _tmp=augdiag(%SHOT%,"VTA","R_core"); _sig=make_signal(SPREAD(value_of(_tmp),1,_nch),SPREAD(value_of(_tmp),1,_nch),dim_of(_tmp,0))

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

z.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

z.name: %TDI%_tmp=augdiag(%SHOT%,"VTA","R_edge"); _ntime= SIZE(_tmp,0); _aux=augdiag(%SHOT%,"VTA","Z_edge"); _sig=make_signal(SPREAD(value_of(_aux),0,_ntime),SPREAD(value_of(_aux),1,_ntime),dim_of(_tmp,0))

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

i_ion.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the ions array of structures. Vector (nimp)
i_ion.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

i_ion.name: Put value here

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.documentation: List of the experimental time bases used for this CPO (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

time.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name
